description:
Requests a magic login link, which will send an email to the user (if found).

- Setting `MagicLink:Enabled` must be enabled (default)
- When using a `RedirectUrl`, configure setting `MagicLink:RedirectDomains` to whitelist supported redirect hosts (recommended!)

Using the returned `RequestToken`, you can either subscribe to the `/magicLink` SignalR hub, or poll the `CheckMagicLink` service. As soon as the emailed magic link is clicked, that hub and service
will return either a `TemporaryToken` you can call `Login` with for this user, or an `APIKey` that's already valid and ready to proceed with.

- The email sent contains a link that will work for 10 minutes
- When clicked, this will generate either a `TemporaryToken` that can be used to `Login` with for 3 minutes, or an `ApiKey` that can be used for 1 hour
- This data is additionally exposed through `CheckMagicLink` for 1 minute after clicking
- When using a `TemporaryToken` to log in with, the resulting `AuthenticationToken` is valid for 1 week (or `SessionDuration:MagicLink`) and will refresh every time when used

Finally, when specifying `IncludeManualCode`, the email sent will also contain a short code for the user to _manually_ input into your application - call `ConfirmMagicLink` with both the `RequestToken`
and that `ManualCode` to obtain either the `TemporaryToken` or `ApiKey` like above, when valid.
